page.title: 12TRANSPORT - KILMERSDON AREA
page.content: Public transport is very inadequate, as the schedule indicates. Thursday - round trip to Radstock and Midsomer Norton, allowing one and a half hours shopping time. Saturday - ditto for Bath, allowing 2 hours. Last Friday in month - round trip to Frome (minibus). Charlton and Newbury have nothing. The busy B3l39 road is a major feature running through Charlton & Kilmersdon and the car is a necessity for most families. The older indigenous population is hardest hit, but many families are inter-related and a relation can often supply the need. There is a Kilmersdon taximan, and the N H S provides a runabout ambulance to take outpatients to hospital appointments. The "good neighbour spirit" takes a friend to the nearest bus station or do shopping. Some younger ones have motor bikes.
